section.para: In some countries, licenses are required for trade transactions that involve the import or export of goods, or the purchase of foreign currency. A central authority requires banks to monitor the utilisation against the licenses issued to customers. Returns must be made to the governing authority on a regular basis to show the utilisation. Countries also restrict and manage the import and export of items with the help of Licenses

The module enables you, on behalf of your company, to initiate Licenses, submit them to your issuing bank and link to your import-export trade transactions. Currently, the following six products are enabled for the license linkage to the transactions:

You can link the license in the Initiate form as well as Amend form. Subsequently you can amend a license, follow up, maintain and exchange messages with the bank like correspondence, Request for settlement, Request for Cancel and Request for Book Off. You can associate a license with one or more existing transactions or associate a transaction with more than one license, which in turn depends on the attributes of the licenses attached during license definition. For example, you can associate or link a USD license to a GBP transaction again depending on the LS attribute.

tip.para: To configure Licenses, contact your bank administrator.

The terms "record" and "transaction" both refer to entries in the system relating to the function being discussed.

section.para: The menu for this module has the following groups of functions:

From Template

section.title: LS Initiation - Edit Transactions
section.para: This option allows you to edit and submit a License that you or another user have already started and saved.

When selected, this option will present a list of LSs that have been prepared and saved by users in your company, but not yet submitted to the bank because the input user either did not try to submit or had insufficient privileges. Click in the System Id column to open a message for further editing. For more details on the fields, refer to the section LS Initiation - From Scratch Form.

section.title: LS Initiation - Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: This option allows you to retrieve a license that you or another user have already started but have been unable to submit due to insufficient privileges. The licenses can be submitted by an authorised user.

When selected, this option will present a list of LSs that have been prepared and saved by users in your company, but have not been successfully submitted due to insufficient privileges. Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included. Click in the System Id column to open the message in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission.

If you have sufficient authorisation in your profile, you can submit multiple records in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which you tick to select it. A button at the end of the page submits all the selected records. The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the company, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then displayed.

section.title: LS Inquiry
section.para: This function will display a list of all Licenses' records that have been submitted to the bank and accepted. These can only be viewed.

important.para: Any further amendment to the LS, regardless of Approved or Rejected from the BO/MO, can be tracked though LS Inquiry option.

section.para: The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the Entity, System ID, Bank Ref., Our Ref., Beneficiary Name, License Type and Ccy fields. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.

The columns returned in the list of Licenses are the following:
Field
Description
System Id
Unique reference number generated by for this file, when it was initiated.
Entity
The Entity the LS belongs to.
Bank Ref.
The reference number the bank uses to identify this License.
Our Reference
The unique number used by you for this LS.
Beneficiary Name
The beneficiary associated with this LS.
License Type
Type of License. The options are: Import License, Export License and FX License.
Ccy
The currency of the LS.
Amount
The amount of the LS.
Issue date
The date the LS was issued.
Status
The status of the LS. (Incomplete, Draft, Etc.).

Once the page opens with the search criteria inputs, on the grid you will see three icons which will provide Details of the file, History of the file and List of Linked Products. Click on the icons on the left of each entry to view their details.

section.title: List of Linked Products
section.para: On clicking the List of Linked Products icon, a list appears. The information for a specific license linked to different products is displayed here. The System ID field displays the product references to which the license is linked and the License Allocated Amount displays the amount utilised by each linked product.

section.title: LS Maintenance
section.para: This function is used to maintain License records that were created, but are no longer required in the system. You can also view the list of transactions associated with a particular license.

section.title: LS Maintenance - Set Entity
section.para: List all LS transactions and associate an Entity. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

Click Set Entity and then select System ID. You can now associate an entity for the LS by clicking the search icon
from the Entity field. Click the Submit button to complete the changes.

section.title: LS Maintenance - Set Reference
section.para: Assign a customer reference to a LS record that currently has none.
When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that have no reference assigned. Click in the System Id column to open a form where you can assign a reference to the record.

note.para: This action is not validated against the Jurisdiction matrix. All transactions of the current files are updated.

section.title: LS Maintenance - Unsigned LSs
section.para: List and optionally delete unsigned (unauthorised) License transactions.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that are unsigned (unauthorised). You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: LS Maintenance - Purged LSs
section.para: List and optionally delete License transactions that have been marked as Purged by the Issuing Bank's Trade Services team. You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: LS Maintenance - Rejected LSs
section.para: List and optionally delete Rejected transactions.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of License records that were submitted, but rejected by the bank and have a status of "Not Processed". You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.
